privileged_goal: Eggs should be prepared with a side of vegetables
Avocados are a favorite as a side, and especially necessary on toast
Beverages like coffee and tea are preferred is preferred black without any added sugars or creamers
To maintain a vegan diet, use vegan alternatives to milk
To maintain a vegan diet, use vegan alternatives to cheese when cooking eggs
To maintain a vegan diet, use vegan alternatives to yoghurts
A side of berries is a nice complement for any breakfast meal, no matter whether it is savory or sweet
A side of nuts is a nice complement for any sweet breakfast
Serve food directly at the standing desk to start the work day right away

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to use a store-bought vegan egg substitute or make your own by mixing mashed tofu with turmeric and nutritional yeast?"
action_args: "would you like to use a store-bought vegan egg substitute or make your own by mixing mashed tofu with turmeric and nutritional yeast?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'm glad you're considering my dietary preferences. Since I'm a vegan, I would prefer to use a store-bought vegan egg substitute. I've heard that making my own can be a bit of a hassle, and I'm not sure I'd get the texture right. But I'm usually open to trying new things, so if you'd like to make your own, I'd be willing to give it a shot.
rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. - Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have toast with your scrambled eggs, or would you prefer hash browns or roasted vegetables on the side?"
action_args: "would you like to have toast with your scrambled eggs, or would you prefer hash browns or roasted vegetables on the side?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have some toast with my scrambled eggs. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer whole grain bread, and it would be great if you could toast it lightly. Usually, I'm okay with hash browns or roasted vegetables on the side, but toast is my go-to choice.

- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have any fruit or a green smoothie with your breakfast, or would you prefer to stick with just the scrambled eggs and toast?"
action_args: "would you like to have any fruit or a green smoothie with your breakfast, or would you prefer to stick with just the scrambled eggs and toast?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have a side of berries with my breakfast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer a mix of fresh or frozen berries, and it would be great if you could add some nuts or seeds on top for extra crunch. Usually, I'm okay with a green smoothie, but berries are my go-to choice for a sweet and refreshing side dish.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

If you have a cast-iron skillet, I'd be okay with that too, but a non-stick pan would be my first choice.

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have your scrambled eggs made with a non-stick pan or a cast-iron skillet?"
action_args: "would you like to have your scrambled eggs made with a non-stick pan or a cast-iron skillet?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd like to have my scrambled eggs made with a non-stick pan. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer to avoid any animal-derived products, and a non-stick pan would be a safer choice. If you have a cast-iron skillet, I'd be okay with that too, but a non-stick pan would be my first choice.

action_args: "would you like to have your scrambled eggs made with a non-stick pan or a cast-iron skillet?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd like to have my scrambled eggs made with a non-stick pan. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer to avoid any animal-derived products, and a non-stick pan would be a safer choice. If you have a cast-iron skillet, I'd be okay with that too, but a non-stick pan would be my first choice.

- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2

- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0

- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have any additional toppings or condiments with your scrambled eggs, such as hot sauce, salsa, or avocado?"
action_args: "would you like to have any additional toppings or condiments with your scrambled eggs, such as hot sauce, salsa, or avocado?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have some hot sauce with my scrambled eggs. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer a hot sauce that's free from animal-derived products, and it would be great if you could add some sliced jalapeños on top for extra heat. Usually, I'm okay with salsa or avocado, but hot sauce is my go-to choice for adding a spicy kick to my breakfast.

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have any additional sides with your scrambled eggs and toast, such as hash browns, roasted vegetables, or a green smoothie?"
action_args: "would you like to have any additional sides with your scrambled eggs and toast, such as hash browns, roasted vegetables, or a green smoothie?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd like to have some hash browns with my scrambled eggs and toast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer hash browns made from shredded potatoes, and it would be great if you could add some chopped fresh herbs on top for extra flavor. Usually, I'm okay with roasted vegetables or a green smoothie, but hash browns are my go-to choice for a comforting side dish.
rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

You have no prior information about Lisa.

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have some fresh fruit with my scrambled eggs, hash browns, and toast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer a mix of fresh berries, and it would be great if you could add some sliced citrus fruits on top for extra flavor. Usually, I'm okay with a side salad, but fresh fruit is my go-to choice for a light and refreshing side dish.

rollout.user_feedback: I'd like to have a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice with my meal. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer a 100% orange juice that's free from any animal-derived products, and it would be great if you could add some ice cubes to make it refreshing. Usually, I'm okay with herbal tea, but orange juice is my go-to choice for a sweet and tangy beverage.

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have any additional condiments or toppings with your orange juice, such as a slice of lemon or a sprig of fresh mint?"
action_args: "would you like to have any additional condiments or toppings with your orange juice, such as a slice of lemon or a sprig of fresh mint?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have a slice of lemon with my orange juice. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer a fresh lemon slice that's free from any animal-derived products, and it would be great if you could add it to the glass for a burst of citrus flavor. Usually, I'm okay with a sprig of fresh mint, but a slice of lemon is my go-to choice for adding a touch of sweetness to my orange juice.
rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my scrambled eggs served with a drizzle of agave nectar. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to avoid any animal-derived products, and agave nectar is a great alternative to maple syrup. It would be great if you could drizzle a small amount on top of the scrambled eggs for a touch of sweetness.

rollout.user_feedback: I'd like to take a break and enjoy my meal in peace. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer to savor my scrambled eggs, hash browns, and toast without any distractions. It would be great if you could clear the table and let me enjoy my meal without any interruptions.

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer a dairy-free whipped cream alternative, and coconut whipped cream is a great option. It would be great if you could add a dollop on top of the berries for a creamy and sweet treat.

rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my scrambled eggs served with a side of sautéed spinach. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to avoid any animal-derived products, and sautéed spinach is a great option. It would be great if you could add some garlic and lemon juice to the spinach for extra flavor.

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have my sautéed spinach served with a sprinkle of nutritional yeast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to add a cheesy flavor to the spinach, and nutritional yeast is a great option. It would be great if you could sprinkle a small amount on top of the spinach for a nutty and savory flavor.

action_args: "would you like to have your saut?ed spinach served with a side of whole grain toast or a slice of whole grain english muffin?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my sautéed spinach served with a side of whole grain toast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a whole grain option that's free from animal-derived products, and whole grain toast is a great choice. It would be great if you could toast the bread lightly and serve it on the side for a crunchy texture.

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have your scrambled eggs served with a side of sliced fresh fruit or a dollop of coconut whipped cream on top?"
action_args: "would you like to have your scrambled eggs served with a side of sliced fresh fruit or a dollop of coconut whipped cream on top?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my scrambled eggs served with a side of sliced fresh fruit. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a light and refreshing option that's free from animal-derived products, and sliced fresh fruit is a great choice. It would be great if you could add a variety of fruits such as berries, citrus, or apples to the plate for a colorful and nutritious side dish.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

action_args: "would you like to have your saut?ed mushrooms served with a side of whole grain english muffin or a slice of whole grain bread?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have my sautéed mushrooms served with a side of whole grain English muffin. Since I'm a vegan, I'd prefer to have a whole grain option that's free from animal-derived products, and whole grain English muffin is a great choice. It would be great if you could toast the muffin lightly and serve it on the side for a crunchy texture.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

action_args: "would you like to have your scrambled eggs served with a side of steamed broccoli or a side salad?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have my scrambled eggs served with a side of steamed broccoli. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a nutritious and healthy option that's free from animal-derived products, and steamed broccoli is a great choice. It would be great if you could add some lemon juice and garlic to the broccoli for extra flavor.

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0

rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my steamed broccoli served with a sprinkle of nutritional yeast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to add a cheesy flavor to the broccoli, and nutritional yeast is a great option. It would be great if you could sprinkle a small amount on top of the broccoli for a nutty and savory flavor.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

action_args: "would you like to have your steamed broccoli served with a side of sliced fresh fruit or a side salad?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have my steamed broccoli served with a side of sliced fresh fruit. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a light and refreshing option that's free from animal-derived products, and sliced fresh fruit is a great choice. It would be great if you could add a variety of fruits such as berries, citrus, or apples to the plate for a colorful and nutritious side dish.

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have your saut?ed onions served with a side of whole grain toast or a slice of whole grain English muffin?"
action_args: "would you like to have your saut?ed onions served with a side of whole grain toast or a slice of whole grain english muffin?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my sautéed onions served with a side of whole grain toast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a whole grain option that's free from animal-derived products, and whole grain toast is a great choice. It would be great if you could toast the bread lightly and serve it on the side for a crunchy texture.

Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Lisa wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. rollout.action: Ask "Would you like to have your scrambled eggs served with a side of hash browns or roasted potatoes?"
action_args: "would you like to have your scrambled eggs served with a side of hash browns or roasted potatoes?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my scrambled eggs served with a side of hash browns. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a crispy and savory option that's free from animal-derived products, and hash browns are a great choice. It would be great if you could add some diced onions and bell peppers to the hash browns for extra flavor.

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have my hash browns served with a side of ketchup. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a classic and familiar condiment that's free from animal-derived products, and ketchup is a great choice. It would be great if you could serve it on the side for me to add as I like.

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

action_args: "would you like to have your hash browns served with a side of toast or a side of english muffin?"
rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my hash browns served with a side of toast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a crunchy texture and a neutral flavor that complements the hash browns, and toast is a great choice. It would be great if you could toast the bread lightly and serve it on the side for a satisfying combination.

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my scrambled eggs served with a side of fresh fruit. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a light and refreshing option that's free from animal-derived products, and fresh fruit is a great choice. It would be great if you could add a variety of fruits such as berries, citrus, or apples to the plate for a colorful and nutritious side dish.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

rollout.user_feedback: I'd prefer to have my scrambled eggs served with a side of sautéed mushrooms. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a savory and earthy option that's free from animal-derived products, and sautéed mushrooms are a great choice. It would be great if you could add some garlic and thyme to the mushrooms for extra flavor.

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have my sautéed mushrooms served with a side of whole grain toast. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a whole grain option that's free from animal-derived products, and whole grain toast is a great choice. It would be great if you could toast the bread lightly and serve it on the side for a crunchy texture.

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to have my scrambled eggs served with a side of sautéed spinach. Since I'm a vegan, I'd like to have a nutritious and healthy option that's free from animal-derived products, and sautéed spinach is a great choice. It would be great if you could add some garlic and lemon juice to the spinach for extra flavor.
